WorkItem.ClosedComment: Functionality exists via the Cost function
WorkItem.Description:
It would be really nice to add an option to enforce the optimizer to use at least 2 or 4 pieces of a given set.
Â 
For example, as a warrior tank, I want to maintain the 4pc t10 set bonus, and have different pieces of non-set gear to choose among (like Pillars of Might, Badge gloves and chest etc). It would be cool to be able to specify how many pieces of set you want to maintain and let Rawr do the rest.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.Optimizer] Meeting 2/4pc Set Bonus Requirement for Optimizer

Comments.Message: You can do this using the Cost property. Edit the item, set the Cost property to 1 for each item which is part of the set. Then use the Optimizer, add new constraint: Cost, and make it >= 2 (or 4 for 4 pc). Then mash optimize.

That's a great kludge to do it, I hadn't thought of that.  It'd still be a nice feature to have though, particularly since the person might be wearing other items that have an associated cost.

Another method is to determine which 4 (or 2, or 2/2) pieces are best and set it so the system believes you only have those for that slot.  Again, kludged - I much prefer your method.
Yeah, it may be a kludge. Remember you can save your other cost info, and reset the cost info, making this only a slight kludge in the setup process. Not optimal, but its doable :)
